src_text: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
ref_text: N'ụbọchị Mọnde, Sara Danius, onye odeakwụkwọ Nobel kọmitii maka akwụkwọ agụmagụ n'ụlọ akwụkwọ Swidin, kwuputara n'ihu ọha na ihe omume redio na Sveriges Redio dị na Swidin, mgbe o siere kọmitii ahụ ike inweta Bob Dilan gbasara mmeri na ihe nrite Nobel na mpaghara Akwụkwọ agụmagụ nke afọ 2016 o nwetara, na ha ahapụlarị mbọ ha na-agba inweta ya.
hyp_text: Ka ọwa, Sara Danius, kọmitii nke Nobel maka Nka nke Akwụkwọ n'akụkụkọmma nke Akụkụ Swedish, na-agbasa na mgbasa ozi nke Sveriges Radio nke Sweden, na-agbasa na ọchịchị mmadụ bụ na ọ ga-ebelata Bob Dylan dị ka onye nwetara 2016 Nobel Prize nke Nka, bụ onye na-enweghi ike ịgbasa ya ọchịchị ọchịchị, na-ahapụ ọchịchị ya ọchịchị ya.

src_text: Because the dinosaur feathers do not have a well-developed shaft, called a rachis, but do have other features of feathers — barbs and barbules — the researchers inferred the rachis was likely a later evolutionary development that these other features.
ref_text: Maka na nku ajọ anụ daịnosọ enweghị akụ toro nke ọma, nke a na akpọ rachis, ma na o nwere ihe ndị ọzọ nke na-enwe - dịka barbs na barbules - ndị nchọpụta ihe kwuru na ọdịka rachis ọbụ ihe mechara si n'ihe ndị ọzọ a were toputa.
hyp_text: N'ihi na njịrị na-ahụ anyịrị na-enweghị ọkwa dị ọkacha mma, a na-akpọkwa rachi, mana na-enweghị ọkwa dị ọkacha mma, ndị ọzọ na-ahụ anyịrị — barb na barbụle — ndị ọkachamara na-enyocha na rachi bụ ihe ọkwa dị ka ihe ọchụnta ego na-aga n'ọrụ na-enweghị ihe ọzọ anyịrị aha.

src_text: The feathers' structure suggests that they were not used in flight but rather for temperature regulation or display. The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.
ref_text: Nhazi nku ha gosiri na ha ejighi ya efe efe kama ha ji ya edokwa okpomọkụ maọbụ eme ihe ngosi. Ndị nchọpụta ihe tụrụ aro sị na, n'agbanyeghị na nke a bụ ọdụ daịnosọ na-eto eto, ihe ngosi ahụ gosiri nku anụ tochara etocha na-abụghị nku nwa anụ.
hyp_text: Nkụnye akpịrị ahụ na-egosi na ha na-eme ka ha na-enweghị iji na-agba ọkụkọ, ma ọ bụrụ na ọ bụ iji ịrịba na ịgbanwe ọnọdụ. Ọkachamara ndị ahụ na-egosi na, nke a bụ ogwe nke ọkọchịrị ọkụkọ, na-egosi ọnọdụ nke ọkọchịrị na ọ dị iche na ọkọchịrị nke ọkọkọ na-acha.

hyp_text: Onye isi ala Stephen Harper na-agwanyere ịbanye nkechiche nke gọọmentị 'Akụkọ Akụkọ N'anya' na komịte na-ahụ maka ịmụma, tupu e nwere ihe dị ka nke abụọ, mgbe ụbọchị Abụọ na ụbọchị asatọ na-eme na ndị isi ala Jack Layton na PMO.

src_text: Bishkek was described as sinking into a state of "anarchy" by one observer, as gangs of people roamed the streets and plundered stores of consumer goods.

hyp_text: Bishkek dị ka agha agha agha n'ime ọnọdụ 'anarachị' site na onye ọkwa, dị ka ịnyị dị ịnyị na-agafe na ọnụ na na-aghị ịnwụ ọdụ na ụlọ ahịa nke ọrụdị ọrụdị.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Emechiri ọkpọkọ mmanụ nke Trans-Alaska ruru maịlụ 800 ka puku kwuru puku gbọmgbọm mmanụ kwafuru na ndịda Fairbanks, nke Alaska."}

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "N’agbanyeghị, Ndị Belgịọm na Swiiz niile na-asụ Frenchị agagọrọ ịmụ Frenchị izugbe n’ụlọ akwụkwọ, ha ga-enwe ike ịghọta ihe ị na-ekwu ma ọ bụrụgodu na ị jiri sistemụ ọnụọgụgụ Frenchị izugbe."}

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Ka afọ na-aga, ndị mmadụ arụọla ụzọ ngafe n'ala mkpọda nke juputara na nkume ruo n'ọnụ ugwu nke lepụgara anya n'oke osimiri."}

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Emechiri ọkpọkọ mmanụ nke Trans-Alaska ruru maịlụ 800 ka puku kwuru puku gbọmgbọm mmanụ kwafuru na ndịda Fairbanks, nke Alaska."}

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga."}

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Kemgbe mbido ya, Di Oniọn abụrụla n'eziokwu alaeze ntaakụkọ na eme ejije n'atọ ọchị, ha nwere mpaghara mbipụta, webụsaịtị nke dọtara ndị ọbịa nde ise pụrụ iche n'ọnwa Ọktoba, mgbasa ozi nke onwe, netwọkụ nke na-enye ntaakụkọ awa ọbula nke dị n'ụbọchị, pọdkastị, nakwa akwụkwọ ngosipụta ụwa a malitere nke a na akpọ Ụwa Anyị N'amaghị Ihe."}

hyp_text: Ocelọtị na-asịrị ụmụ anụmanụ nke ukwuu. Ha ga-ebu mmụọ ọkụlọ, ọkụlọ, ụzọlụ na nnụnụ ma ọ bụrụ ha na-enwe ike. Nke agha bụrụ na anụmanụ bụ isi ocelọtị na-enweghi ike ịgafe ha.

src_text: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
ref_text: Ndị mmadụ anọjughị otu ebe na Grinland. N'akụkọ Norse ha sị na achụfuru Erik the Red n'obodo Iceland n'ihi igbu ọchụ, ma mgbe ọ na aga njem na mgbada ọdịda anyanwụ, ọchọpụtara Grinland wee gụọ ya Grinland.
hyp_text: Grinlịdị nọrọ na-enweghị mmadụ. N'akụkọ Norse, ha na-ekwu na Erik the Red nwetara ịrịba n'Iceland n'ọnwụ, na mgbe ọ na-erule na ndịda, nwetara Grinlịdị na-emepe ya Grinlịdị.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Ka afọ na-aga, ndị mmadụ arụọla ụzọ ngafe n'ala mkpọda nke juputara na nkume ruo n'ọnụ ugwu nke lepụgara anya n'oke osimiri."}

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Emechiri ọkpọkọ mmanụ nke Trans-Alaska ruru maịlụ 800 ka puku kwuru puku gbọmgbọm mmanụ kwafuru na ndịda Fairbanks, nke Alaska."}

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga."}

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Kemgbe mbido ya, Di Oniọn abụrụla n'eziokwu alaeze ntaakụkọ na eme ejije n'atọ ọchị, ha nwere mpaghara mbipụta, webụsaịtị nke dọtara ndị ọbịa nde ise pụrụ iche n'ọnwa Ọktoba, mgbasa ozi nke onwe, netwọkụ nke na-enye ntaakụkọ awa ọbula nke dị n'ụbọchị, pọdkastị, nakwa akwụkwọ ngosipụta ụwa a malitere nke a na akpọ Ụwa Anyị N'amaghị Ihe."}

hyp_text: Ebe ọchịchị bụ ụzọ ndụ nke mba. Ọchịchị ụwa na-egosi ịbanye na ịzụ ụzọ ịkọ ụzọ site na ọtụtụ ndị ọkachamara, ọnụ ụzọ ọdị ọkacha mmadu na ịdị ọkacha mmadu.

src_text: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
ref_text: N'afọ 1683, ndị agha ezinụlọ ọchịchị Shịng (1644-1912) weghaara akụkụ mmiri Taịwan dị n'ọdịda anyanwụ na nke dị n'ugwu ma kwuputa na Taịwan bụzi mpaghara n'okpuru ọchịchị Alaeze Shịng n'afọ 1885.
hyp_text: N’afọ 1683, ndị Qing dynasty (1644-1912) nwetara ịkpaala nke ala ndị ọwụla na ndị ọwụla nke Taiwan ma jị Taiwan dị ka mpaghara Qing Empire n'afọ 1885.

src_text: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
ref_text: Na 1895, mgbe a dachara n’Agha Sino-Japanese Mbụ (1894-1895), ọchịchị Qing ahụ mere mbịanye aka na Nkwekọrịta nke Shimonoseki ahụ, site na nke o jiri nyefee Japan ọbụbụeze nke Taiwan, nke na-achị agwaetiti ahụ ruo 1945.
hyp_text: N'afọ 1895, mgbe mgbe ọchị na Agha Sino-Japanese mbụ (1894-1895), ọchịchị Qing ji Treaty of Shimonoseki, nke na-egosi na ọ na-akpa ịchị na Taiwan na Japan, nke na-erule ọnụ ụzọ ahụ ruo afọ 1945.

src_text: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
ref_text: Nakwa n’etiti usoro ndị eze ọ bụla bụ otu oge ejighị n'aka mke mpaghara ndị kewara ekewa. Oge ndị a nke a kacha mara amara bụ oge nke Alaeze Atọ nke mere ruo afọ iri na isii n'etiti Usoro Ndị Eze Han na Usoro Ndị Eze Jin ndị ahụ.
hyp_text: N'etiti ọchịchị dị iche iche, dị iche iche nke ụwa nke dị ịrịba; agha na-eto aha nke a bụ ọkwa ọchịchị mmadụ ụmụ anọ nke dị na afọ 60 n'etiti ọchịchị Han na ọchịchị Jin.

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.

src_text: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
ref_text: N'Oktoba 6, 1789, ụmụ nwanyị ahịa iwe ji yiri Eze Luwi XVI oke egwu mgbe ha si na Versailles dọrọ ya, nwunye ya Marịa Antwanet, obere ụmụ ha abụọ (Marịa Teriza dị afọ 11 na Luwi-Chals dị afọ anọ), na nwanne nwanyị Eze, Madam Elizabet, dọghachi ha na Parii.
hyp_text: Nneke Louis XVI, nwunye Marie Antoinette, ụmụ ha abụọ (Marie Therese nke afọ iri na itoolu na Louis-Charles nke afọ anọ) na nne nna ha, nwunye Elizabeth, n'ọnwa 6 nke afọ 1789, bụrụla agha na Paris site na Versailles site na mmadụ ndị mmadụ nke ahịa.

src_text: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
ref_text: Ọ bụrụ na ị hụtara onwe gị na-ewubergharị elekere gị n’ime nrọ gị, e nwere ike idobe ya n’akụkụ nke ọzọ nke ime ụlọ ahụ, na-amanye gị isi n’akwa bilie ịgbanyụ ya.
hyp_text: Mgbe ị nwesịrị ọkwa ọkwa ị n'ụlọ, ị ga-enye ya na ọnụ ọgụgụ ọzọ n'ọdịdị ọha, mgbe ị ga-eme ka ị gafe n'ụlọ ị nwere ike ịrịba ị dị na ị ga-eme ka ọ dị ọzọ.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "N’agbanyeghị, Ndị Belgịọm na Swiiz niile na-asụ Frenchị agagọrọ ịmụ Frenchị izugbe n’ụlọ akwụkwọ, ha ga-enwe ike ịghọta ihe ị na-ekwu ma ọ bụrụgodu na ị jiri sistemụ ọnụọgụgụ Frenchị izugbe."}

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Ka afọ na-aga, ndị mmadụ arụọla ụzọ ngafe n'ala mkpọda nke juputara na nkume ruo n'ọnụ ugwu nke lepụgara anya n'oke osimiri."}

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Emechiri ọkpọkọ mmanụ nke Trans-Alaska ruru maịlụ 800 ka puku kwuru puku gbọmgbọm mmanụ kwafuru na ndịda Fairbanks, nke Alaska."}

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga."}

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Kemgbe mbido ya, Di Oniọn abụrụla n'eziokwu alaeze ntaakụkọ na eme ejije n'atọ ọchị, ha nwere mpaghara mbipụta, webụsaịtị nke dọtara ndị ọbịa nde ise pụrụ iche n'ọnwa Ọktoba, mgbasa ozi nke onwe, netwọkụ nke na-enye ntaakụkọ awa ọbula nke dị n'ụbọchị, pọdkastị, nakwa akwụkwọ ngosipụta ụwa a malitere nke a na akpọ Ụwa Anyị N'amaghị Ihe."}

ref_text: Ka a na-ewetulata esemokwu ahụ, ka ike ndụ nọ ugbu a na-adịkwuo mma. Mmadu niile nwere ike mmepụta ịchọta udo zuru oke na afọ ojuju.
hyp_text: Ọkwa ọnụ ọgụgụ, ọkwa ịhụnanya ọma nke ọbụla onwe ya. Ọnye mmadụ anọ nwere ike ịma ụlọ ihe ọha na ịhụnanya.

src_text: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.

src_text: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.

hyp_text: N'ụzọ na-eme ka Buddhism Tibetan bụ n'oge na-eme ka ọ bụrụ na-eme ka na-adị ọbụna. Ọ na-enweelụ ọkwa na Kundalini Yoga, meditation na ọnọdụ ọha na-emeghe.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Ka afọ na-aga, ndị mmadụ arụọla ụzọ ngafe n'ala mkpọda nke juputara na nkume ruo n'ọnụ ugwu nke lepụgara anya n'oke osimiri."}

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Emechiri ọkpọkọ mmanụ nke Trans-Alaska ruru maịlụ 800 ka puku kwuru puku gbọmgbọm mmanụ kwafuru na ndịda Fairbanks, nke Alaska."}

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga."}

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Kemgbe mbido ya, Di Oniọn abụrụla n'eziokwu alaeze ntaakụkọ na eme ejije n'atọ ọchị, ha nwere mpaghara mbipụta, webụsaịtị nke dọtara ndị ọbịa nde ise pụrụ iche n'ọnwa Ọktoba, mgbasa ozi nke onwe, netwọkụ nke na-enye ntaakụkọ awa ọbula nke dị n'ụbọchị, pọdkastị, nakwa akwụkwọ ngosipụta ụwa a malitere nke a na akpọ Ụwa Anyị N'amaghị Ihe."}

src_text: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
ref_text: Obodo nke Casablanca nke ugbu a bụ Berber fishermen wubere ya na BCE narị afọ nke iri, ma ndị Phoenicia, Rome, na ndị Merenid jiri ya dị ka ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri dị oke mkpa akpọrọ Anfa.
hyp_text: Ọdịdị modern nke Kasablanca bụ otu Berber mmadụ mmiri na-eme ihe mgbe ọkara 10 BCE, na bụrụla n'ụzọ n'ime Phoenicians, Romans, na Merenids dị ka ọdụ ọkachamara a kpọrọ Anfa.

hyp_text: Eze ndị ọbịa na-asụkarị ịbanye ndị ọrụ na-ewepụ na ịmepụta ọrụ ọrụ, ịbanye ọrụ na ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ, ma ọ bụ ịbanye ọrụ na ọrụ ọrụ ọrụ na ọrụ ọrụ.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "N’agbanyeghị, Ndị Belgịọm na Swiiz niile na-asụ Frenchị agagọrọ ịmụ Frenchị izugbe n’ụlọ akwụkwọ, ha ga-enwe ike ịghọta ihe ị na-ekwu ma ọ bụrụgodu na ị jiri sistemụ ọnụọgụgụ Frenchị izugbe."}

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Ka afọ na-aga, ndị mmadụ arụọla ụzọ ngafe n'ala mkpọda nke juputara na nkume ruo n'ọnụ ugwu nke lepụgara anya n'oke osimiri."}

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Emechiri ọkpọkọ mmanụ nke Trans-Alaska ruru maịlụ 800 ka puku kwuru puku gbọmgbọm mmanụ kwafuru na ndịda Fairbanks, nke Alaska."}

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga."}

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Kemgbe mbido ya, Di Oniọn abụrụla n'eziokwu alaeze ntaakụkọ na eme ejije n'atọ ọchị, ha nwere mpaghara mbipụta, webụsaịtị nke dọtara ndị ọbịa nde ise pụrụ iche n'ọnwa Ọktoba, mgbasa ozi nke onwe, netwọkụ nke na-enye ntaakụkọ awa ọbula nke dị n'ụbọchị, pọdkastị, nakwa akwụkwọ ngosipụta ụwa a malitere nke a na akpọ Ụwa Anyị N'amaghị Ihe."}

src_text: In inland regions of Northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is commonly used in curries; in Southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is commonly used.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Ka afọ na-aga, ndị mmadụ arụọla ụzọ ngafe n'ala mkpọda nke juputara na nkume ruo n'ọnụ ugwu nke lepụgara anya n'oke osimiri."}

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Emechiri ọkpọkọ mmanụ nke Trans-Alaska ruru maịlụ 800 ka puku kwuru puku gbọmgbọm mmanụ kwafuru na ndịda Fairbanks, nke Alaska."}

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga."}

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

src_text: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
ref_text: Na imaatu, kwa afo umu-akwukwo sitere Ulo-akwukwo Bennet di na mpaghara ugwu Carolina na aruputa otu websaiti banyere njem ha na Isi Obodo, kwa afo aga arozihari websaiti a, mana aga edowe udidi ochie ya na ikuku iru oru dika akwukwo-efu.
hyp_text: Nke a, ọkwa, ụmụ akwụkwọ na-eme na Bennet School na North Carolina na-akpọ aha ịnyị dị ka ịnyị na-egosi njem ha na Ọchịchịalị Mba, ọkwa ọkwa, ịnyị na-eme emume mgbe ọkwa, mana ịnyị ndị ọhụrụ na-enweghị ike ịdị ọhịa na-enweghị ike ịdị ọhịa nke na-enweghị ike ịdị ọhịa nke dị ka scrapbook.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Ka afọ na-aga, ndị mmadụ arụọla ụzọ ngafe n'ala mkpọda nke juputara na nkume ruo n'ọnụ ugwu nke lepụgara anya n'oke osimiri."}

[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.

[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Igbo]: {"translation": "Akụkụ Beljọm ga nke ugbua bụbu akụkụ Lukzembọọgụ n’oge gara aga mana mechaa bụrụ Beljian mgbe e nwere mgbanwe ọchịchị n’ike nke Beljian n'afọ 1830 ga."}

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
